simplified: Many people have common dreams. These dreams show that they are thinking about something. The key is to understand what these dreams mean for you.

In Moscow, there are many wild dogs. They live on the streets. Some dogs are born in the wild, and others were pets that were left alone. Some dogs live alone, and others live with friends. Scientists have studied the dogs and found that they are very good at living in the city. They know how to cross the street with people.

Wonder is New Yorker RJ Palacio's first book. She saw a girl on the street who looked different, and that made her write the book. Many schools use it to talk about bullying and being different. There is a movie coming out, and I want to read more.

Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. She has told people many times that rats are clean pets if you take care of them. Some people still don't like rats. Chloe used to not like rats either, but her friend Martin showed her his rats and she liked them. Now Chloe has two of Martin's rats.

Some baboons can get hurt in Cape Town. They have been injured in cars or electrocuted while playing with cables. Baboons are in danger and the city council has a team to help. The team tries to keep baboons out of the city or catch them and put them in the countryside. The team is doing some good work, but it is hard to keep baboons from coming back.

I work for a global IT company. They are based in the States, so I work from home. I don't waste time going to the office. I work on a project basis, which is good for me because it means I can take time off when I need to. But sometimes I work late and miss dinner.
In the 90s, graffiti continued. Many artists made art to show that people should be equal. Others just made pretty pictures. In some cities, artists added colour to grey walls.
People are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. They buy things online easily and major brands sell very cheap clothes that people wear and then throw away.

Sam looked at the dust on the ground from the car. The horses were not paying attention to him. Sam waited. Mr Carter was not coming out. Sam liked that. The more he avoided Mr Carter, the more he got a job. Mr Carter wiped the sweat from his neck. His shirt was getting wet. He was getting a sunburn. Sam was already getting a tan from sitting indoors all day.

Many people in Berlin do not like the way pigs are treated. Some people hunt them, but others think it's cruel. The city council decided to put up fences and make it illegal to feed the pigs. We'll see if this works.

Suzanne was inspired by classical Greek mythology when she was a child. One of her favourite stories was about Theseus and the Minotaur. They were forced to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. The boys and girls were thrown into a big maze and eaten by a monster. But Theseus killed the monster. Suzanne likes Katniss Everdeen, who is like Theseus.
Zoos help people learn about animals and the environment. They also take care of animals that have been hurt. Some zoos do research to help animals feel better.
Many people are now against buying things. They used to buy a lot on special days like Black Friday. Now they protest and cut up their credit cards. People also give away things they have.

Is graffiti art or vandalism? It depends on what you think. Many people think it's vandalism. The police stop street artists and they have to pay fines. Some cities are very expensive to clean graffiti from buildings.

People think graffiti is art. Recently, it's getting more respect. There are big exhibitions of graffiti in galleries in Paris, London and New York. A woman named Elura Emerald showed her art in a gallery in New York. She said that people who paint on the street are just being themselves, and they shouldn't be hurt. They should be liked.
People have 2,000 dreams per year. Most people forget 95% of their dreams. Even if we remember just a few thousand, it's possible that a dream will come true.

The Hunger Games is set in the future, in a country called Panem. The country is divided into twelve districts, ruled by the wealthy Capitol. The Capitol controls everything. Each district does something for the Capitol. District 12 produces coal for the country. There was a thirteenth district but they rebelled against the Capitol and were destroyed.

Many wild animals come into cities to find food. In Cape Town, baboons have been coming into homes to eat fruit and food from bins and gardens. Some baboons even go into houses and take food from the kitchen. People don't like the baboons because they can be aggressive and hurt pets.
Many accidents happen when building a bridge. This is often because the engineers made a mistake. The bridge can collapse, and this can be very dangerous for the workers.

George Lucas made a film called Star Wars. The main character, Luke, lives a normal life. One day, he gets a message that makes him go on an adventure. Luke finds the message in a robot. This is the start of his journey.

One idea to stop an asteroid from hitting Earth is to use a big bomb. This idea was in a film called Armageddon. But it's not a joke. NASA has a plan to stop the asteroid. They would fire eight big rockets at it to change its course. If the asteroid is too close, they would use smaller bombs to blow it up.

Campbell says that the hero first refuses to go on an adventure, but a wise man helps him and he decides to go on a journey. He then meets new friends and fights against bad people. The hero meets Obi-Wan, Han Solo, and two robots, and faces the biggest challenge inside the Death Star.

Many things that are not used are not useful to some, but can be useful to others. The internet has made it easy for people to sell and buy things they no longer need, and this is called sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries two ideas about dreams became popular. One idea said that our dreams show us things we don't know about ourselves. The other idea said that dreams are just random thoughts. When we wake up, we try to make sense of them.

I am a freelancer. I like being my own boss. At first, I worked from home, but it was hard to concentrate. I had too many distractions. Then I moved to a café, but the Wi-Fi was bad. I started to work in a co-working space with other freelancers. It was better for me. I like going to the office every day.

Whether NASA can find the remaining small asteroids depends on getting the money to build a new telescope that can see in infrared light. If it gets the money, it might be able to stop the big asteroids in ten years.

Many famous people on social media are now saying you don't need to buy anything. Some people even don't buy anything for a year. Two friends in Canada tried to live without buying anything for a year. They learned to live without clothes, food, and electricity for the first three months. Then they stopped buying things like haircuts, eating out, and petrol for their cars. They saved $55,000 in a year.

Pi's religion is very important to him. He is Hindu, but he also wants to know about other religions. He makes friends with a priest and a baker who are Christian and Muslim. People are surprised when Pi says he is all three religions at the same time. His family and teachers don't want him to choose just one religion. Pi says 'I just want to love God'. Now his family and teachers agree to let him decide.

Some people think that writing your dreams down can help you have a better dream. A better dream is when you know you're dreaming and you can control what happens in it. This means you can change a bad dream into a good one, or you can make the story of your dream like a movie. Then, instead of just understanding your dreams, you can make them happen!

People donate their unwanted clothes to charities, but charities can't sell them all. People don't want to buy old clothes because they are of poor quality. This means a lot of clothes are thrown away and sent to other countries, causing problems.

Many people don't stop after one exciting trip. Meagan McGrath from Canada has done many difficult things, like climbing a mountain on each continent, riding a bike across Canada, and running in the Sahara Desert in very hot weather. She also went skiing to the South Pole. But she fell into a glacier on the first day and had to be rescued. Many people would have given up, but she didn't. She carried on and reached the South Pole forty days later. She pulled a sledge with her food and tent. She did this in very cold and icy weather.
Blek le Rat painted rats on Paris walls. He paints people who are homeless to help people think about the problem.

Some councils encourage artists to paint in certain areas instead of painting on walls everywhere. Taiwan has special areas where artists can paint. In São Paulo, some artists can paint on the subway trains.

Faith47 is from Cape Town in South Africa. She paints big, colourful pictures of people and animals. She likes to explore and put her paintings in different places. Most of her paintings will be gone soon. This makes her happy because life is always changing.

Gabriela worked in a country with a high power distance culture. In this culture, leaders make big decisions and are not often challenged. Her team in Sweden worked in a low power distance culture. In Sweden, leaders are like coaches, not bosses. They encourage their team to think for themselves and are challenged often.

Gabriela noticed that she and her team had different cultures. She asked them how they felt about her leading the team. They said they didn't like being told what to do. They wanted to have more freedom to make their own decisions. When Gabriela told them what to do, they felt she didn't trust them. They thought she was taking it personally when they disagreed with her.
Brothers from São Paulo paint everything on the sides of buildings. They even paint huge pictures of people with colours. They need big machines to help them. They painted a whole castle in Scotland.

People have painted and written on walls throughout history. They painted pictures of animals and people in caves. Graffiti is found on old buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria and Iraq. People in Pompeii wrote messages on buildings in Latin. They wrote about religion, politics and love. They even wrote magic spells.

Do you want to climb a big mountain or walk across a continent? Many people do these things every year. They use special devices like GPS to help them. Some people are also helping animals and people in need.
The first is a test called DART. It will test DART on the moon of an asteroid called Didymos. The moon is very small. The DART will try to make it leave its orbit.

Katniss is a sixteen year old girl who lives in a poor place. Her father died in an accident and she has to feed her family. She hunts with her friend Gale and gets very good with a bow and arrow. Her little sister Prim is chosen for a dangerous game, so Katniss volunteers to go instead. She goes with a boy named Peeta from her district. They become friends, but also have feelings for each other.
Think about the people and place in your dream as they might add to the meaning. Over a week, you'll write down many things. This helps you connect your dreams to your daily life.
Old bridges were made of wood and often caught fire. The sparks from the train wheels could make a bridge burn.

Street art is becoming more popular. Young people are painting in their city. More artists are moving around the world. They use the internet to show their work. The art world is starting to accept street art. Street art will always be around.

Suzanne Collines has never liked watching news about wars. When she was a child, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and he fought in Vietnam. Her mother tried to protect her by not telling her what was happening in the war, but she still saw the news and knew that her dad was there. It was very frightening for her.
More than 40,000 people, including millennials, answered a survey about their work.

Erik Weihenmayer is a very adventurous person from the United States. He has climbed many big mountains like Everest. Erik is blind, but he still likes to travel and climb. He helps other blind people to climb mountains too.
Many people are making money from the internet. They can sell things they no longer need, like old clothes and baby equipment. This makes it easy for people to earn some extra money.

Pi and Richard Parker are on a lifeboat for 227 days. They survive many bad things, like hunger, sickness, and rainstorms. Pi finds comfort in three different religions, but he is also very sad and lonely at times. After a long time, the Mexican coast appears and they finally reach land.

Chloe went home from school. She made a cup of coffee and went to her bedroom. She had homework, but she could do it later. She liked being quiet before her parents came home. She liked playing with her pet rats.
In 2010, NASA found 90% of big asteroids near Earth. These asteroids are like mountains. They can be very close to Earth. NASA says they are not a danger to the planet.

Auggie goes to school for the first time. He is very anxious because of how he looks. Nobody wants to sit with him, and kids stare at him. But he makes friends with Jack and Summer. They help him at school. Some kids are scared of him because of a disease. Auggie has many problems, but he gets help from his friends. He has a very bad experience at a camp.

The two men looked to the north end of the land. It was very big. The fences were not visible from where they stood. A teenage boy might get bored, but he couldn't escape on foot. Sam looked at a big horse. The horse was kicking its hooves. Could the boy ride? There was trouble for anyone who didn't know horses and wanted to get away from his father.

Over 4,000 people from 13 to 80 years old have climbed Everest. Climbing high mountains in bad weather is very dangerous, but many good climbers now want to try new things. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria loves climbing. She used to be a nurse, but she still climbs in her free time.
Gerlinde climbed Everest and now she wants to climb the other 13 big mountains. She climbs without oxygen. This is very dangerous. Gerlinde is famous and she uses her fame to help poor children.

We can see that not all things we own are used. For example, the thick coat we bought but never wore, the phone we bought and put away, the car we only use on weekends, and the extra room in our house that is now a storage room.

Throughout history and in many cultures, people thought dreams were messages from the gods. They believed dreams could give us information or help us understand things. Many people can remember a dream and then it happens in real life.

Many of the biggest transportation projects in the world involve building bridges. Bridges are very important as they help cars, trucks and trains to cross rivers, mountains and roads. They are very important in civil engineering and people watch them very closely because they can sometimes collapse.
After many days of frustration, Gabriela emailed her manager. She told him that her team was not working well and she didn't feel happy with the way things were going.

Dogs that live in groups can find food easily by being small and cute. Some dogs know how to use the metro to travel between different parts of their area. Scientists don't know how they do it. One idea is that they use their good sense of smell to find their favourite places. They might also know the names of the stations they hear. People now get used to seeing dogs on the trains and don't pay attention to them.

Ed Stafford from the UK walked the length of the Amazon River. He started in Peru and ended in Brazil, two years and four months later. The Amazon rainforest is very dangerous, with poisonous snakes, crocodiles and jaguars. Ed survived, but got a few mosquito and ant bites.
In Britain, people spend around £1,000 on new clothes each year. This money is borrowed from credit card companies, and they owe a lot of it. Britain also throws away a lot of old clothes.

Ed's journey would not have been possible without technology. He used a radio to ask for food and permission from the people he met in the rainforest. They helped him and he wrote a blog about his journey. He used the media to raise money for charities to protect the rainforest.

Many businesses are making money from unused resources. Companies create websites that connect people who have things with people who need them. For example, people can rent their homes or cars on these websites. Companies like Airbnb and Uber make money by helping people use their extra things.

Zoos help endangered animals by breeding them in a safe place. Many animals in the wild have no mates and are killed by poachers. Zoos make sure these animals can live and have babies safely. This helps keep the animals healthy. If many animals in the wild are in danger, breeding programmes can help. The babies born in zoos can be released back into the wild to help the species.

Boats and trains can cause a bridge to collapse for different reasons. Trains can cause a bridge to collapse because of the speed of the train. Boats can cause a bridge to collapse because of their weight. The best way to avoid bridge failures is to plan for them. Modern technology can help.

Pi is scared of the animals. He jumps into the ocean. But he is scared of sharks too. He must go back to the boat. The animals in the boat start eating each other. Only Pi and a tiger are left. The tiger is sick and doesn't want to eat Pi.

When Pi was 16, his parents didn't like the new government. They decided to close the zoo and move to Canada. They took some animals with them on a ship to Canada. But the ship sank in a storm and they all drowned. Pi was left in a lifeboat with a hyena, a zebra, an orang-utan and a tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book for teenagers. It was written by Suzanne Collins and has been translated into many languages. It is also a very successful film. Many people bought the book and the film was very successful. It made a lot of money.

Dreams are the result of our mind thinking about things we did during the day. But in dreams, our thoughts appear with symbols and have special meanings. When we're awake, our thoughts are words, like talking to ourselves. But when we're asleep, our brain stops working on language and starts working on emotions.

Being happy is linked to good relationships. People who are happy usually have a lot of friends and family and spend time with them often. It's also good to have someone you can talk to about your feelings. Just one friend is enough for a good conversation. You also need people you can trust and feel comfortable with. It's not just about having lots of friends, but having people you really care about.
Carol Dweck said that our brains can change and we can get better at things we're not good at. People often praise us for our talents, but praising how we do things can help us get better.
Mars has air that has methane in it. The air goes in and out of the planet at different times. It makes the planet seem like it is breathing.

A psychologist gave children some hard problems to solve. One group liked the challenge and thought their brains could get better. The other group thought their brains were fixed and couldn't get better. They were unhappy. Some children said they might cheat to feel better.

Horror films like empty places. They can be an old hospital, a empty house or a ghost town. There's something about being alone. What was it like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's the quiet, which can be scary too. Abandoned places are good for horror films because you won't have a phone there.

No matter what kind of house, the basement is a scary place. It's usually where bad things hide or where the bad person is hiding. Basements are always dark and damp. You can only go down by a small staircase. Even when there's nothing there, the basement is still creepy.

Gary Collins, a policeman, watched the riots on TV. He recognised some people and came back early to help. He spent six months looking at the CCTV film and found 190 people. He helped the police a lot. Even with a lot of footage, computers couldn't find many people.
I think it's cool to think about how we'll change as a species with new technology. Maybe we can put a computer in our brain soon. This idea will become more common.

I thought the talk was very interesting. The speaker made a few good points about how parents influence teenagers. They can't do their homework if they see their parents on their phones. People also want to be in two places at once. They switch between their real life and online conversations. I see this with my daughter and her friends. They meet up and sit together in silence while talking on their phones.

There are two kinds of news about the world. One is bad, and the other is good. There were 30 wars between 1945 and 1990. Today, most countries live in peace. But there are some problems. There has been a big increase in terrorism, and many people have died in wars. However, the murder rate has gone down a bit. It is still very dangerous to be killed by a criminal. But it is less likely to be killed by a terrorist.

Wasfia helps women and girls learn things. She sees problems when her projects stop. She wants to change things in Bangladesh. She started climbing when she worked in other countries. Now people in Bangladesh are listening to her.

Many people think that poor countries are very unhappy. But this is not true. Things are getting better. More than 700 million people have a better life now. Many children are not dying from diseases. More girls are going to school and people have clean water.

Many managers try to make their feedback more positive by saying something nice before saying something bad. But this can make employees think that the nice things are just covering up the bad things. Employees should get positive feedback to help them do well.

I'm a member of a group that tries to stop killer robots. Robots like drones and gun turrets are already used to kill people. Soon, they will be able to kill on their own. I think this is very bad for humanity. We need to be careful what we ask machines to do.

More people are learning English than other languages, and it's spoken in many countries. But Chinese has more native speakers than any other language. There's no clear link between the number of native speakers and learners. However, the number of learners is linked to the number of countries that speak the language.

Your manager stops you and says you need to talk about your performance on the recent project. You worry about it all weekend, wondering what you did wrong. She starts by saying you did good work, but then tells you what you did wrong. She ends by saying you did good work again.

Born in the USA is a very emotional rock album with powerful songs. The songs tell the story of the American dream and how it can be very difficult to achieve. Many people in the album are unhappy with their lives. The song Glory Days is about a small town where people look back on when they were young and happy. Downbound Train is about a young man who loses his job and becomes unhappy. The singer is likely writing about people he knows and the life he wishes he had. The album shows the singer's great talent.

Lewis wants more marine protected areas to stop the harm caused by humans. He has seen the damage with his own eyes. The oceans are dying because of pollution and overfishing. If we don't help the oceans, we may have a big problem.

Best-selling author Terrie Sharp can tell a good story. She won an award twice and was born in a tough Glasgow area. She learned to be quiet and safe. Now she appears on TV shows and writes about crime.
Are things getting worse every day? Is progress an impossible goal?

Older horror films were very hard to watch because the characters could not call for help. Now, with mobile phones, it's a bit more believable. What can we do to make it more scary? No phone signal! If you are a hero in a horror film, you will probably not have phone signal when you need it most. Or your phone will run out of battery just when you need to call.

In the 1950s, Central American banana growers lost their most valuable fruit, the Gros Michel. Now they are losing the Cavendish, too. The Gros Michel was a popular fruit because it was easy to transport and sweet. United Fruit grew and exported many bananas. It made clones of the bananas instead of planting new ones from seeds.

Spider venom can hurt people, but most spiders don't want to attack humans. Only a few spiders can hurt us, and their bites can be painful. Some spiders, like tarantulas, have hairs that can hurt us if we touch them wrong.
Horror films from the last century often featured a girl who is the last one alive. She is usually shy and weak at first, but then becomes strong and brave. She always survives in the end.

If we want to know how our brains make complex language, we need to look at how our brains are different from other animals. Our brains can do many things that other animals can't. But there are not many physical clues to help us. We can see that early humans' mouths, throats and tongues changed a lot. This happened about 100,000 years ago. Before then, scientists can only guess how early humans communicated.

Girls should do arts and humanities, not maths and physics. There are few female scientists in cartoons and stories. People think scientists are lonely and do not have friends. But these are not true. If girls saw more female scientists, they would feel more confident and happy.

The Scallion is a free newspaper printed weekly. It is read by about 10,000 students. It is made by students for students. Most students like it. However, some students can't get it because they can't go to university. It is also bad for the environment.

At Girox Foods, about 12 per cent of employees leave every year. This is a bit high, but the industry standard is only 7 per cent. We want to find out why people leave and make suggestions to keep them happy and prevent them from leaving.

I think we feel lonely when we are connected to the world. My generation knows how to be alone and it's okay. But younger people are busy talking and never get to be alone. They learn how to talk on their phones, but not how to talk to real people.

Don't always give negative feedback when you get positive feedback. When you give both positive and negative feedback, people might not pay attention to the positives. You should give positive feedback sometimes just for being good, and try not to criticize.

Your dreams can give you insights into things you didn't know you were thinking about. Many people's common dreams, like flying or falling, probably mean something similar. To understand what your dreams mean, you need to connect them to your daily life.

Many wild dogs live in Moscow. There are about 35,000 of them. Some were born in the wild, others were pets that were left behind. Some dogs live alone, while others live in groups. Scientists studied the dogs in 2010 and found that they have adapted well to city life. They have learned to cross the street with people and seem to understand traffic lights.
Wonder is a bestseller novel by New Yorker RJ Palacio. It came from seeing a girl with facial deformities. Many schools use it to discuss bullying and friendship. A film is being made.

Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. She knows people often react badly to them because she's tried to explain they're not dirty animals, but can make great pets if you look after them properly. Chloe changed her mind after seeing her friend's rats, which were affectionate and intelligent. Last year, she decided to have two rats after one of her friend's had babies.

Cape Town can be a dangerous place for baboons. They have been injured in car accidents and electrocuted while playing with cables. Baboons are endangered and the city council has hired a team of monitors to keep them away from the city. The monitors catch the baboons and release them in the countryside. This policy has helped, but it's hard to stop them from coming back.

I work for a global IT company, but they are based in the US, so I do all my work from home. This means I don't have to waste time commuting or chatting with colleagues. I work on projects and this flexibility is great because I can take time off when I need to. However, without clear office hours, I often work late into the evening.

In the 1990s, graffiti continued and street art spread around the world. Some artists created art that made a point about war, inequality and discrimination, while others created beautiful work. In South America, street artists added colour to poor areas, making them look more attractive.

Many shops and magazines show people many things to buy. People in Britain buy more clothes and shoes than ever. Buying things online is very easy. But some brands make very cheap clothes that we don't think twice about throwing away after just a few uses.

Sam looked at the dusty trail left by the car. The horses didn't seem to mind the flies. Sam waited for his boss to come out. He liked it when Mr. Carter stayed inside because it meant he could avoid his work for longer. Mr. Carter wiped the sweat from his neck. His shirt was getting wet and his skin was turning red. He had a nice tan from staying inside all day.

Many city residents in Berlin complained about shooting pigs as it was unnecessarily cruel. Hunters and animal lovers had heated arguments over it. The city council decided to take a more peaceful approach instead. They put up fences and made it illegal to feed the pigs. Whether this strategy works is yet to be seen, but warmer winters may lead to more pigs.

Suzanne's love of classical Greek mythology inspired her to write the Hunger Games book. She liked a story from childhood about a hero who fought a monster in a maze. This story influenced the idea of Katniss Everdeen fighting the Capitol in the Hunger Games.

Zoos can educate people about conservation issues and inspire them to protect animals. They can also provide a safe home for animals that have been mistreated or abandoned, and carry out important research into animal behaviour and illness treatment.

A new trend is emerging against consumerism. It started in Canada in the 1990s and spread to the US. This movement opposes overspending and overconsumption during Black Friday and Cyber Monday. On Buy Nothing Day, people protest and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, Buy Nothing groups exchange and repair items they already own.

Is graffiti art or vandalism? This depends on what you think. In many countries, writing or painting on buildings and other property is considered vandalism. Many street artists have been stopped by police and had to pay fines. City councils are unhappy about the cost of cleaning graffiti off buildings and other things.

The art world is becoming more accepting of street art. There have been exhibitions of street art in big cities like Paris, London and Los Angeles. In 2008, an American artist named Elura Emerald showed her work in New York. She said that street artists are just expressing themselves and not causing any harm. They should be appreciated.

Most people have four to six dreams every night after they are ten years old. They have around 2,000 dreams per year. By the time they are 80, they might have had 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget most of our dreams, that's still a few thousand. It's not hard to believe that a dream event is followed by a real-life event that's similar.

The Hunger Games is set in a future America. The country is called Panem and is divided into twelve poor districts ruled by the rich Capitol. The Capitol has complete control over the nation. Each district provides different things for the Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, produces all the coal for the country. There used to be a thirteenth district, but they rebelled against the Capitol and were destroyed.

Often wild animals come into cities to find food. In Cape Town, baboons are entering homes to eat fruit and other food. They can be aggressive and have attacked many pets. Many people don't like having them around.

A lot of bridge accidents happen when a bridge is being built. These accidents are often caused by mistakes made by the engineers. The bridge can collapse under its own weight, which can be very dangerous for the workers on it.

George Lucas was one of the first film directors to use the 17 stages of the hero's journey in his stories. The hero usually starts with a normal life, but something happens that changes everything. In Star Wars, Luke starts his journey when he finds a message from Princess Leia inside a robot. This is the start of his adventure.

According to Campbell, a hero's journey starts when they refuse the call, but a mentor helps them. The hero then faces tests, fights enemies, and meets friends, preparing to face their biggest challenge. Luke's mentor is Obi-Wan, his friends are Han Solo and the robots R2D2 and C3PO. The enemy is Darth Vader in the special world of the Death Star.

People often think useless things are worthless, but they can be valuable to others. The internet has helped people make money from sharing these things. Now, people can easily buy and sell second-hand goods through websites and social media groups, and this is called the sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, there were two main ideas about dreams. One was that dreams reveal our hidden feelings. The other theory was that dreams are just random brain activity. When we wake up, we try to make sense of our dreams and put them into a story.

I work for myself as a freelancer. It's great because I am in control. At first, I worked from home, but it was hard to concentrate because there were many distractions. I decided to work in a café, but the Wi-Fi wasn't good and I drank too much coffee. I then moved to a co-working space where I could focus and like going to the office every day.

Whether NASA can find the remaining asteroids depends on getting the money to build a space telescope that can locate them using infrared light. If they get the money, they can probably achieve their goal in ten years. Once the asteroids are logged, the team will still need to figure out how to defend the planet against the big, worrying asteroids.

Many social media influencers are now promoting the 'buy nothing' trend. Some popular YouTubers even suggest not buying anything for a year. In Canada, two friends tried this for a year and managed to save $55,000.

Pi thinks religion is very important. His family is Hindu, but he is also curious about other religions. He is friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Many people are surprised when Pi says he is all three religions. When his family and teachers ask him to choose one, he says he just wants to love God. They let him decide about religion.

Some people think that writing your dreams can help you have more control over your dreams. Lucid dreams are when you're aware that you're dreaming and can make things happen in your dream. By writing down your dreams, you can turn a bad dream into a good one or make your dreams feel safer. This way, you can create your own dreams instead of just trying to understand them. You might still want to have some dreams that help your subconscious tell you what's on your mind.

Many people donate their old clothes to charities. However, charity shops can't sell all of them. 'Fast fashion' is not worth buying second-hand because it's of poor quality. As a result, unwanted clothes are thrown away, and charities send the rest abroad, causing more economic and environmental issues.

Many adventurers go from challenge to challenge. One example is Meagan McGrath from Canada, who has climbed the highest mountain on each continent and run a race in the Sahara Desert in very hot weather. She also skied to the South Pole. On her trip, she fell into a glacier and had to be rescued. But she decided to continue. She pulled a sledge with her food and tent for forty days through very cold and icy weather.
Blek le Rat began painting rats in Paris. He now paints to raise awareness of homelessness.

Some councils try to stop graffiti on walls by letting artists work in designated areas. Taiwan has 'graffiti zones' where artists can paint freely. In São Paulo, Brazil, artists are allowed to paint on the city's subway trains.

Faith47 is from Cape Town in South Africa. She paints big pictures of people and animals. She likes to find new places to paint and her work can be found on pavements, in empty buildings and on old cars. She likes that most street art is temporary and will be gone soon. She thinks this is like life, where things change and then start again.

Gabriela came from a culture where power and authority were highly respected. In her previous work environment, leaders made the major decisions and were rarely questioned. In contrast, her Swedish team were used to a culture where everyone worked together to find solutions. In Sweden, leaders were more like coaches, encouraging independent thought and expecting to be challenged.

When Gabriela realized the cultural differences between her and her team, she decided to have an open conversation about their feelings about her leadership. Her team appreciated being asked for their thoughts and openly expressed that they didn't like being told what to do. They enjoyed having more room for initiative and creative freedom. They felt that Gabriela didn't trust them to do their job well when she told them exactly what to do. They realized that Gabriela was taking it personally when they tried to challenge or change her decisions, and explained that this was how they had always worked.

Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint everything, from tags to big colourful pictures of people on buildings. Their paintings are so big they need cranes. In 2007, they painted a whole castle in Scotland.

People have been painting and writing on walls throughout history. In the past, people in Africa and Europe painted pictures of animals and people. Graffiti has been found on old buildings. People in ancient Greece, Italy, Syria and Iraq also wrote messages on buildings. Archaeologists found graffiti in Pompeii, a Roman town, where they wrote in Latin about their personal feelings and beliefs.

Many people dream of climbing high mountains or walking across continents. They use modern technology like GPS and satellite phones to help them. Some are nature lovers, while others want to help people and raise money for charities.

The first is the Double Asteroid Redirection Test. A spacecraft called DART will hit an asteroid called Didymos. This will try to move the asteroid out of its path so it can be seen by Earth-based telescopes.

Katniss Everdeen, a 16-year-old girl, has lost her father in a mining accident. She has to provide food for her family and hunts in the woods with her friend Gale. When her sister is chosen as a tribute, Katniss volunteers to go instead. She meets a boy named Peeta and they have a complicated relationship.

Writing about your dreams can help you remember more details. Think about who was there and where it happened, as this might add to the meaning. You might be surprised at how much you write in a week. Then you can connect your dreams to your daily life.

More bridges were made of wood and were more likely to catch fire. This was especially true of old-fashioned train bridges. The spark from the steel wheels and tracks could sometimes cause a fire, which would burn the bridge to the ground.

Street art is changing, but some trends are clear. More and more street artists are traveling and working around the world. They are also using the internet to communicate and share their work. The art world is becoming more aware of street art as a valid art form. In the future, street art will continue to exist.

Suzanne Collines finds news programmes about wars upsetting. When she was a child, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and fought in Vietnam. Her mother didn't tell her what was happening in the war, but she still saw the news and knew her dad was there. It was a frightening experience for her.
More than 40,000 millennials were asked in a survey about their work life and how they like to work.

Erik Weihenmayer from the US is a multi-adventurer who has done many incredible things. He has been blind since he was 13, but still manages to travel the world and encourage people with disabilities to live active lives.

Democratised online platforms are giving people a chance to make some money. They can now sell old things like baby clothes and pushchairs that they no longer need. This is helping parents to earn some cash back.

Pi and Richard Parker spend 227 days in a lifeboat. They have to deal with hunger, illness and exhaustion. They face violent storms and the heat of the sun, but they survive. Pi finds comfort in his religions, but also feels lonely and sad. Eventually, they see the Mexican coast and everything changes. It's best to read the book to find out what happens next.

Chloe came home from school, made a cup of coffee and took it to her room. She had some homework but that could wait. She liked the quiet time before her parents came home and the evening sounds. She liked playing with her pet rats during this time.

In 2010, NASA identified 90% of near-Earth asteroids. These asteroids, or NEOs, are the size of mountains and are up to 50 million km away from Earth. NASA says none of the 887 asteroids it knows are a danger to the planet.

Auggie starts at a new school and feels anxious. Nobody wants to sit next to him because of how he looks. He makes friends with two kids, Jack and Summer. But some of his classmates are scared of him because they think he might have the plague. Auggie faces many problems at school, but he eventually makes a big change after a traumatic event at a school camp.

Two men looked at the northern end of the property. It went on for miles. They couldn't see the fences. A teenage boy might get bored, but it's not possible to escape on foot. Sam looked at a big horse. He wondered if the boy could ride. There was a lot of trouble for a good rider. But maybe there was even more trouble for someone who didn't know horses and wanted to escape from his father.

Over 4,000 people aged thirteen to eighty have climbed to the top of Everest. Climbing high mountains is very dangerous, but experienced climbers look for new challenges. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner, from Austria, started climbing mountains as a teenager. She climbed while she was a nurse, but enjoyed it in her free time.
Gerlinde climbed Everest and now she is planning to climb all the world's 8,000 metre peaks. She climbs without oxygen and it's very risky. She uses her fame to help poor children in Nepal.

If we look around us at the things we have bought, we would see that not all of them are being used. For example, the thick coat we bought to look fashionable, but live in a warm country, is rarely used. Similarly, our old smartphone, the car we only use on weekends, and the guest room that has been converted into a storage room are not being used either.

Throughout history and across cultures, people believed that dreams were messages from the gods. They thought these dreams would give us knowledge or insight. Many people can remember a dream and then the dream actually comes true in real life.

Many of the biggest bridges in the world are built to cross rivers, mountains and valleys. They are very important for cars, trucks and trains to travel across. Many people think bridges are very important for civil engineering.

After weeks of problems, Gabriela emailed her manager about the issues she was facing with her team. Her manager asked her if the team was still working well and what she thought would help her work better with her team members. Gabriela didn't feel satisfied with the manager's response.

Many dogs that live in groups have learned to go to the train station to get food for their pack. Some have even mastered the metro system to travel between areas of their territory. Scientists are not sure how the dogs find the right train stop, but they might use their sense of smell or the train announcements to do so. Now, the dogs are a familiar sight on the trains and are often ignored by passengers.

Ed Stafford from the UK is the first person to walk the length of the Amazon River. He started in Peru and arrived in Brazil after two years and four months, walking 6,000 kilometres. The Amazon rainforest is full of poisonous snakes, crocodiles and jaguars, but Ed survived with just a few mosquito bites.

In Britain, people spend over £1,000 on new clothes each year, which is about four percent of their income. This spending hides two problems for society and the environment. Firstly, most people pay for clothes on credit cards. Currently, British people owe around £670 to credit card companies. This is 66 percent of the average cost of new clothes. Secondly, people are buying things they don't need, using money they don't have. As a result, Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes each year.

Ed couldn't have done his walk without technology. He used a radio to ask for help and permission to cross the rainforest. Many people came to meet him and helped him through the difficult terrain. He wrote a blog about his journey, and used the media to raise money for charities in Brazil and Peru.

Many companies have realised the benefits of the sharing economy. These companies provide online platforms where people can buy or rent products and services. Companies like Airbnb and Uber make money by letting people use their homes or cars.

Many modern zoos help endangered animals by breeding them in a safe environment, which can help the animals find mates and have babies. Without zoos, some of these animals might not survive. Zoos can also help by releasing the babies into the wild, which increases the genetic diversity of the species.

Both of these kinds of accidents are extremely rare. However, boats and trains can cause a bridge to collapse for different reasons. Trains can bring a bridge down due to their speed. Boats, however, can bring about the collapse due to their massive size, even when moving slowly. The best way to avoid bridge failures is to plan for them. Modern technologies and better designs can help to reduce these accidents.

Pi was initially terrified of the animals. He jumps into the ocean. However, he remembers that there are sharks in the water and decides to return to the lifeboat. On the way back, the animals in the lifeboat kill each other, and only Pi and a tiger are left. Luckily, the tiger is seasick and doesn't want to eat Pi.

When Pi is 16, a new government is elected that his parents don't like. His parents are worried about the future, so they decide to leave the zoo and move to Canada. They sell some of the animals to zoos in North America and travel by ship to Canada. On the way, a storm hits and the ship sinks. Pi's family and the sailors all die, but Pi is left alone in a lifeboat with a hyena, zebra, orang-utan, and a big tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book by Suzanne Collins. It was first published in 2008 and has been translated into many languages. The book has sold millions of copies worldwide and has also been made into a successful film. In the United States, it made a lot of money in its first weekend.

Dreams are like a summary of our daily thoughts. When we're awake, our thoughts appear as words in our minds. But when we're asleep, our brain changes, and we have more emotional thoughts. This might be why our dreams have symbolic meanings.

Good relationships are very important for being happy. Happy people usually have close friends and family and spend time with them. They also need someone to talk to about their feelings. Just having lots of friends isn't enough; you need to feel connected to them. Listening to others is also important for strong relationships.

Many of us focus our praise on the end result and seemingly innate talents, but research suggests that praising effort, experimentation and problem-solving strategies can help develop new skills and hone existing talents.

A spacecraft called the rover periodically examines the air around it. In 2014, it discovered methane in the air. Methane only survives for a short time. This means that there must be something on Mars that produces more methane. NASA says that Mars releases a lot of methane at one time. The amount of methane in the air goes up and down throughout the year, like the planet is breathing.
A group of ten-year-olds were given some problems that were a bit too hard for them. One group thought it was fun to try and one group didn't like it and felt their intelligence was being judged.

Horror films often take place in deserted places, like an empty house or a ghost town. These places are usually quiet and can be very scary. People often leave these places for various reasons, and it's possible that they're abandoned because of their silence. This silence can be a good setting for horror films.
Basements in horror films are usually scary. They are dark and damp, and you can only reach them by a narrow staircase. The atmosphere in basements is always creepy.

Gary Collins, an off-duty policeman, was watching the riots on TV. He immediately recognised some people and went back to help. He looked at the CCTV film for six months and identified 190 people, many just by their eyes. His help was very important in the investigation. Even with lots of footage, the facial recognition software only managed to identify one person.

Personally, I think it's interesting to consider how we'll speed up our evolution as a species by making our bodies better. Imagine if you could put a computer in our brain! Soon we'll be able to do that and improve our math skills, hearing and memory. This idea will become more common.

The speaker gave a great talk and hit the nail on the head with a couple of points. For example, parental influence can make teenagers not want to focus on their homework when they see their parents doing the same things on social media. The speaker also made a good point about people wanting to be in two places at once. This is why people switch between real-life and online conversations. I see this happen with my teenage daughter and her friends, who often sit in silence while chatting online.
There is a balance between violent news and good news. Since World War II, there have been fewer wars, but more people have died in terrorism. However, the global murder rate has decreased slightly.

Wasfia has spent her life helping human rights. She saw that Bangladesh needed to stand up for itself and started a project to change attitudes towards women. She first learned to climb while working in Tibet and Nepal, but now she is trying to change the world's view of women in Bangladesh. Her campaign seems to be working, as people are starting to take notice.

Many people think that developing countries are in a bad situation. However, this is not true. In fact, a lot of progress is being made. More than 700 million people have become richer, and many children are getting better healthcare. Also, more girls are going to school and having access to clean water.
Many managers use positive comments to soften negative feedback, but employees can see it as just a way to hide the truth. Instead, positive feedback should be used to encourage good performance.

I'm a member of a campaign that tries to stop killer robots. These machines, like drones and turrets, are already being used to kill with very little human help. If we make them able to kill by themselves, it would be completely wrong and dangerous for humanity. We need to be very careful about what we ask them to do.

More people learn English than any other language and it's spoken in more countries. However, Chinese has the most native speakers. There's no clear link between the number of native speakers and learners, but the number of learners is linked to the number of countries where the language is spoken.

Your manager stops you to discuss your recent project performance. You worry about it over the weekend, thinking about what you might have done wrong. On Monday morning, she starts by praising you for the good work you've done, and you wonder if this is just to make you feel good before giving you the bad news.

Born in the USA is a rock album with emotional lyrics. The catchy melodies hide stories of the American dream's dark side. Many songs are about ordinary people struggling with life not giving them wealth or fame. The song Glory Days looks back at people's youth, while Downbound Train tells a story of someone losing his job and losing his life. The artist probably wrote about real people and the life he might have had. The album shows Bruce Springsteen's unique talent.

Lewis wants to see more marine protected areas to help the environment. During his travels, he's seen the damage caused by humans. He's swum over coral reefs and seen underwater deserts filled with plastic. Pugh thinks nature can recover if we give it space, but time is running out. If we don't take care of our seas, we may face a big problem soon.

Best-selling author Terrie Sharp is very good at writing stories. She's been to the police show twice and has won an award for it. She was born on a housing estate in Glasgow. She learned to stay out of trouble and open car doors with a knife. She only uses her knowledge to write her books. She's now very active, appearing on TV shows and at writing conferences.

Is everything getting worse? Is it impossible to make progress? According to Steven Pinker, things are actually getting better. We live longer, healthier lives now. But the real problem is that people are being misled by bad ideas and that can harm our democracy and international cooperation.

In older horror films, it was hard to call for help or the police. Now mobile phones make that less believable. To maintain suspense, people don't have phone coverage. In a horror film, you're likely to lose signal at a crucial moment when you need to call for help, or your phone battery might run out just as you're making the call.

In the 1950s, Central American banana growers lost their most profitable fruit, the Gros Michel banana. Now, the same is happening to its replacement, the Cavendish. The Gros Michel was popular because its fruit was easily transported and tasted sweet. United Fruit was the main grower and exporter, and it produced bananas by cloning plants instead of growing them from seeds.

Most spiders produce venom to stun or kill their food, but only a few species can harm humans. Some spider bites can be painful, but they are rarely fatal. In Australia, the Sydney funnel-web spider has not killed anyone since anti-venom was developed. If you touch a hairy spider, like a tarantula, it will defend itself by releasing hairs that can irritate your skin or eyes.

Horror movie clichés were especially popular in the late 20th century. The movie starts with a group of teenagers enjoying themselves, and it ends with everyone dead except one girl. At the beginning the girl is shy and innocent, but by the end she is strong and resourceful. The last girl usually wins in the end.

To understand how humans developed complex language, we need to look at our brain's differences from other animals. Our brain's ability to process information and its evolution is crucial. Unfortunately, we can't find many physical clues to help us understand how our ancestors spoke. However, studying the remains of early humans shows us that their mouth, throat, and tongue developed over time, which allowed them to make complex sounds by 100,000 years ago.

Girls are told to like arts and humanities and not maths and physics. They don't see many female role models doing science jobs. Cartoons and stories often show scientists as men. There's a false idea that scientists are lonely and don't have many friends. This makes girls think science is not a good job. If they saw more female role models in science, they would feel more confident and happy doing science subjects.

The university newspaper is printed weekly and is given away free in the buildings. It is made entirely by students. Many students value it for entertainment, culture and work experience. However, it's expensive to print, and some students can't get a copy easily because they have to go to the university to get one. This is also bad for the environment as many copies are thrown away on campus.

At Girox Foods, the annual employee turnover is about 12 per cent. The industry standard is seven per cent. This report aims to investigate employee engagement and provide recommendations to improve the workplace experience and increase employee retention.

Many people say what the speaker said is true. I think we feel more isolated when we are connected. I don't think this is a problem for my generation because we've grown up without technology. We know how to be alone and think it's okay. But younger people are different. They're always talking and never have time to be alone. This can stop them from learning to enjoy their own company. They learn to talk by messaging, which is not the same as talking in person.

Positive and negative feedback should not be given together. Positive feedback can become less important if negative feedback is always given. We should make sure to give positive feedback just for itself and not give negative feedback unless it's really necessary.
